Appendix A Examples of generalized Weisfeiler-Leman algorithms

Proposition A.1.

A GFWL instance with t=1𝑡1t=1italic_t = 1, N=1𝑁1N=1italic_N = 1, M=1𝑀1M=1italic_M = 1, (i0,i1)=(0,k)subscript𝑖0subscript𝑖10𝑘(i_{0},i_{1})=(0,k)( italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , italic_k ), (j0,j1)=(0,1)subscript𝑗0subscript𝑗101(j_{0},j_{1})=(0,1)( italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , 1 ), ℛ⁢(G)=𝒱Gkℛ𝐺superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑘\mathcal{R}(G)=\mathcal{V}_{G}^{k}caligraphic_R ( italic_G ) = caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ℱ⁢(G,𝐮)=𝒱Gℱ𝐺𝐮subscript𝒱𝐺\mathcal{F}(G,\mathbf{u})=\mathcal{V}_{G}caligraphic_F ( italic_G , bold_u ) = caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any 𝐮∈𝒱Gk𝐮superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑘\mathbf{u}\in\mathcal{V}_{G}^{k}bold_u ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in Assumption 4.4 gives an instance of k𝑘kitalic_k-FWL [4, 18].

Proposition A.2.

A GFWL instance with t=1𝑡1t=1italic_t = 1, N=1𝑁1N=1italic_N = 1, M=1𝑀1M=1italic_M = 1, (i0,i1)=(0,k)subscript𝑖0subscript𝑖10𝑘(i_{0},i_{1})=(0,k)( italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , italic_k ), (j0,j1)=(0,1)subscript𝑗0subscript𝑗101(j_{0},j_{1})=(0,1)( italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , 1 ), ℛ⁢(G)=𝒱Gkℛ𝐺superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑘\mathcal{R}(G)=\mathcal{V}_{G}^{k}caligraphic_R ( italic_G ) = caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ℱ⁢(G,𝐮)=⋃ℓ=1k𝒩⁢(uℓ)ℱ𝐺𝐮superscriptsubscriptℓ1𝑘𝒩subscript𝑢ℓ\mathcal{F}(G,\mathbf{u})=\bigcup_{\ell=1}^{k}\mathcal{N}(u_{\ell})caligraphic_F ( italic_G , bold_u ) = ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for 𝐮=(u1,…,uk)∈𝒱Gk𝐮subscript𝑢1…subscript𝑢𝑘superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑘\mathbf{u}=(u_{1},\ldots,u_{k})\in\mathcal{V}_{G}^{k}bold_u = ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in Assumption 4.4 gives an instance of local k𝑘kitalic_k-FWL [27]. When k=2𝑘2k=2italic_k = 2, this is exactly the SLFWL(2) proposed in Zhang et al. [26], which is strictly more powerful than all node-based subgraph GNNs (the latter defined by Frasca et al. [14]).

Proposition A.3.

A GFWL instance with k=2𝑘2k=2italic_k = 2, t=1𝑡1t=1italic_t = 1, N=1𝑁1N=1italic_N = 1, M=1𝑀1M=1italic_M = 1, (i0,i1)=(0,2)subscript𝑖0subscript𝑖102(i_{0},i_{1})=(0,2)( italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , 2 ), (j0,j1)=(0,1)subscript𝑗0subscript𝑗101(j_{0},j_{1})=(0,1)( italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , 1 ), ℛ⁢(G)={(u,v)∈𝒱G2:d⁢(u,v)⩽δ}ℛ𝐺conditional-set𝑢𝑣superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺2𝑑𝑢𝑣𝛿\mathcal{R}(G)=\{(u,v)\in\mathcal{V}_{G}^{2}:d(u,v)\leqslant\delta\}caligraphic_R ( italic_G ) = { ( italic_u , italic_v ) ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : italic_d ( italic_u , italic_v ) ⩽ italic_δ } and ℱ⁢(G,(u,v))={w∈𝒱G:d⁢(u,w)⩽δ⁢ and ⁢d⁢(w,v)⩽δ}ℱ𝐺𝑢𝑣conditional-set𝑤subscript𝒱𝐺𝑑𝑢𝑤𝛿 and 𝑑𝑤𝑣𝛿\mathcal{F}(G,(u,v))=\{w\in\mathcal{V}_{G}:d(u,w)\leqslant\delta\text{ and }d(% w,v)\leqslant\delta\}caligraphic_F ( italic_G , ( italic_u , italic_v ) ) = { italic_w ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_d ( italic_u , italic_w ) ⩽ italic_δ and italic_d ( italic_w , italic_v ) ⩽ italic_δ } in Assumption 4.4 gives an instance of δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ-DRFWL(2) [30].

Proposition A.4.

A GFWL instance with N=k𝑁𝑘N=kitalic_N = italic_k, M=t𝑀𝑡M=titalic_M = italic_t, (i0,i1,…,iN)=(0,1,…,k)subscript𝑖0subscript𝑖1…subscript𝑖𝑁01…𝑘(i_{0},i_{1},\ldots,i_{N})=(0,1,\ldots,k)( italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , 1 , … , italic_k ) and (j0,j1,…,jM)=(0,1,…,t)subscript𝑗0subscript𝑗1…subscript𝑗𝑀01…𝑡(j_{0},j_{1},\ldots,j_{M})=(0,1,\ldots,t)( italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( 0 , 1 , … , italic_t ) in Assumption 4.4 gives an instance of (k,t)𝑘𝑡(k,t)( italic_k , italic_t )-FWL+ [12]. Further with ℛ⁢(G)=𝒱Gkℛ𝐺superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑘\mathcal{R}(G)=\mathcal{V}_{G}^{k}caligraphic_R ( italic_G ) = caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ℱ⁢(G,𝐮)=𝒱Gtℱ𝐺𝐮superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑡\mathcal{F}(G,\mathbf{u})=\mathcal{V}_{G}^{t}caligraphic_F ( italic_G , bold_u ) = caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any 𝐮∈𝒱Gk𝐮superscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺𝑘\mathbf{u}\in\mathcal{V}_{G}^{k}bold_u ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the resulting GFWL instance is an instance of (k,t)𝑘𝑡(k,t)( italic_k , italic_t )-FWL [12].

Appendix B Proof of Theorem 4.11

Proof.

(a) ⇒bold-⇒\bm{\Rightarrow}bold_⇒ (b). Since W⁢(G)≠W⁢(H)𝑊𝐺𝑊𝐻W(G)\neq W(H)italic_W ( italic_G ) ≠ italic_W ( italic_H ), we have

W0(∞)|G≠W0(∞)|H,evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐻\displaystyle W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{G}\neq W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{H},italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (16)

where we have used the subscripts to disambiguate between the colors computed for graphs G𝐺Gitalic_G and H𝐻Hitalic_H. Our proof relies on the following lemma.

Lemma B.1.

Given equation (16), the following statement holds for each n=1,2,…,N𝑛12…𝑁n=1,2,\ldots,Nitalic_n = 1 , 2 , … , italic_N: if Duplicator has not lost after the (n−1)𝑛1(n-1)( italic_n - 1 )-th putting move of the initialization round, then either (i) Duplicator loses after the n𝑛nitalic_n-th putting move of the initialization round, or (ii) Spoiler can maintain that

Wn(∞)⁢(𝐮n)|G≠Wn(∞)⁢(𝐯n)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝑛subscript𝐮𝑛𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝑛subscript𝐯𝑛𝐻\displaystyle W_{n}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{n})|_{G}\neq W_{n}^{(\infty)}(% \mathbf{v}_{n})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (17)

after the n𝑛nitalic_n-th putting move of the initialization round.

Proof of Lemma B.1. We prove by induction. By equation (14), W0(∞)|G≠W0(∞)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐻W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{G}\neq W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT implies

AGGR0⁢(null;W1(∞)⁢(⋅)|G,ℛ1⁢(G))≠AGGR0⁢(null;W1(∞)⁢(⋅)|H,ℛ1⁢(H)),subscriptAGGR0nullevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1⋅𝐺subscriptℛ1𝐺subscriptAGGR0nullevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1⋅𝐻subscriptℛ1𝐻\displaystyle\mathrm{AGGR}_{0}(\text{null};W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\cdot)|_{G},% \mathcal{R}_{1}(G))\neq\mathrm{AGGR}_{0}(\text{null};W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\cdot)|_% {H},\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)),roman_AGGR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( null ; italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) ) ≠ roman_AGGR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( null ; italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) ) , (18)

or simply

ℋ({{W1(∞)(𝐮~)|G:𝐮~∈ℛ1(G)}})≠ℋ({{W1(∞)(𝐯~)|H:𝐯~∈ℛ1(H)}}),\displaystyle\mathcal{H}\left(\{\!\!\{W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})|_{G% }:\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)\}\!\!\}\right)\neq\mathcal{H}\left(% \{\!\!\{W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\tilde{\mathbf{v}})|_{H}:\tilde{\mathbf{v}}\in% \mathcal{R}_{1}(H)\}\!\!\}\right),caligraphic_H ( { { italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) } } ) ≠ caligraphic_H ( { { italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) } } ) , (19)

where ℋ⁢(⋅)ℋ⋅\mathcal{H}(\cdot)caligraphic_H ( ⋅ ) is the same injective hashing function for both sides. Equation (19) implies that either (i) |ℛ1⁢(G)|≠|ℛ1⁢(H)|subscriptℛ1𝐺subscriptℛ1𝐻|\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)|\neq|\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)|| caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) | ≠ | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) |, or (ii) for any bijection f:ℛ1⁢(G)→ℛ1⁢(H):𝑓→subscriptℛ1𝐺subscriptℛ1𝐻f:\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)\rightarrow\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ), there exist 𝐮~∈ℛ1⁢(G)~𝐮subscriptℛ1𝐺\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) and 𝐯~=f⁢(𝐮~)∈ℛ1⁢(H)~𝐯𝑓~𝐮subscriptℛ1𝐻\tilde{\mathbf{v}}=f(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG = italic_f ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ), such that

W1(∞)⁢(𝐮~)|G≠W1(∞)⁢(𝐯~)|H.evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1~𝐮𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1~𝐯𝐻\displaystyle W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})|_{G}\neq W_{1}^{(\infty)}(% \tilde{\mathbf{v}})|_{H}.italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (20)

If (i) is the case, Duplicator loses after the first putting move of the initialization round, since she fails to choose a bijection f:ℛ1⁢(G)→ℛ1⁢(H):𝑓→subscriptℛ1𝐺subscriptℛ1𝐻f:\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)\rightarrow\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ). Otherwise, for any bijection f:ℛ1⁢(G)→ℛ1⁢(H):𝑓→subscriptℛ1𝐺subscriptℛ1𝐻f:\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)\rightarrow\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) chosen by Duplicator, Spoiler can put pebbles p1,…,pi1subscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝subscript𝑖1p_{1},\ldots,p_{i_{1}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at Δ⁢𝐮1=𝐮~∈ℛ1⁢(G)Δsubscript𝐮1~𝐮subscriptℛ1𝐺\Delta\mathbf{u}_{1}=\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ), thus forcing Duplicator to put pebbles q1,…,qi1subscript𝑞1…subscript𝑞subscript𝑖1q_{1},\ldots,q_{i_{1}}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at Δ⁢𝐯1=𝐯~∈ℛ1⁢(H)Δsubscript𝐯1~𝐯subscriptℛ1𝐻\Delta\mathbf{v}_{1}=\tilde{\mathbf{v}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)roman_Δ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ); after the first putting move, we see that 𝐮1=Δ⁢𝐮1=𝐮~subscript𝐮1Δsubscript𝐮1~𝐮\mathbf{u}_{1}=\Delta\mathbf{u}_{1}=\tilde{\mathbf{u}}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG and 𝐯1=Δ⁢𝐯1=𝐯~subscript𝐯1Δsubscript𝐯1~𝐯\mathbf{v}_{1}=\Delta\mathbf{v}_{1}=\tilde{\mathbf{v}}bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_Δ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG. Therefore, equation (20) implies W1(∞)⁢(𝐮1)|G≠W1(∞)⁢(𝐯1)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1subscript𝐮1𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1subscript𝐯1𝐻W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{1})|_{G}\neq W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{1})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We have then proved Lemma B.1 for the case of n=1𝑛1n=1italic_n = 1.

Now assuming that Lemma B.1 holds for the case of n=n~−1𝑛~𝑛1n=\tilde{n}-1italic_n = over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 with 2⩽n~⩽N2~𝑛𝑁2\leqslant\tilde{n}\leqslant N2 ⩽ over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ⩽ italic_N, we now prove Lemma B.1 for the case of n=n~𝑛~𝑛n=\tilde{n}italic_n = over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG. When n=n~𝑛~𝑛n=\tilde{n}italic_n = over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG, it is supposed that Duplicator has not lost after the (n~−1)~𝑛1(\tilde{n}-1)( over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 )-th putting move of the initialization round. By the inductive hypothesis, this implies that Spoiler can maintain

Wn~−1(∞)⁢(𝐮n~−1)|G≠Wn~−1(∞)⁢(𝐯n~−1)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛1subscript𝐮~𝑛1𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛1subscript𝐯~𝑛1𝐻\displaystyle W_{\tilde{n}-1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1})|_{G}\neq W_% {\tilde{n}-1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (21)

after the (n~−1)~𝑛1(\tilde{n}-1)( over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 )-th putting move of the initialization round. By (14), equation (21) means that

AGGRin~−1⁢(𝐮n~−1;Wn~(∞)⁢(⋅)|G,ℛn~⁢(G))≠AGGRin~−1⁢(𝐯n~−1;Wn~(∞)⁢(⋅)|H,ℛn~⁢(H)),subscriptAGGRsubscript𝑖~𝑛1subscript𝐮~𝑛1evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛⋅𝐺subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscriptAGGRsubscript𝑖~𝑛1subscript𝐯~𝑛1evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛⋅𝐻subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻\displaystyle\mathrm{AGGR}_{i_{\tilde{n}-1}}(\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1};W_{% \tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}(\cdot)|_{G},\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G))\neq\mathrm{AGGR}% _{i_{\tilde{n}-1}}(\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1};W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}(\cdot)|_{% H},\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(H)),roman_AGGR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) ) ≠ roman_AGGR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) ) , (22)

or equivalently,

ℋ({{Wn~(∞)((𝐮n~−1,𝐮~))|G:𝐮~∈ℛn~(G)\𝐮n~−1}})\displaystyle\mathcal{H}\left(\{\!\!\{W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}((\mathbf{u}_{% \tilde{n}-1},\tilde{\mathbf{u}}))|_{G}:\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{% \tilde{n}}(G)\backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1}\}\!\!\}\right)caligraphic_H ( { { italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } } )
≠ℋ({{Wn~(∞)((𝐯n~−1,𝐯~))|H:𝐯~∈ℛn~(H)\𝐯n~−1}}),\displaystyle\neq\mathcal{H}\left(\{\!\!\{W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}((\mathbf{v}% _{\tilde{n}-1},\tilde{\mathbf{v}}))|_{H}:\tilde{\mathbf{v}}\in\mathcal{R}_{% \tilde{n}}(H)\backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}\}\!\!\}\right),≠ caligraphic_H ( { { italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } } ) , (23)

in which ℋ⁢(⋅)ℋ⋅\mathcal{H}(\cdot)caligraphic_H ( ⋅ ) is the same injective hashing function for both sides (but can be different from the one in equation (19)). Equation (23) implies either (i) |ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1|≠|ℛn~⁢(H)\𝐯n~−1|\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻subscript𝐯~𝑛1|\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)\backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1}|\neq|\mathcal{R}% _{\tilde{n}}(H)\backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}|| caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≠ | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT |, or (ii) for any bijection f:ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1→ℛn~⁢(H)\𝐯n~−1:𝑓→\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻subscript𝐯~𝑛1f:\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)\backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1}\rightarrow% \mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(H)\backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, there exist 𝐮~∈ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1~𝐮\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)\backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}% -1}over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and 𝐯~=f⁢(𝐮~)∈ℛn~⁢(H)\𝐯n~−1~𝐯𝑓~𝐮\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻subscript𝐯~𝑛1\tilde{\mathbf{v}}=f(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})\in\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(H)% \backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG = italic_f ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, such that

Wn~(∞)⁢((𝐮n~−1,𝐮~))|G≠Wn~(∞)⁢((𝐯n~−1,𝐯~))|H.evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐮~𝑛1~𝐮𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐯~𝑛1~𝐯𝐻\displaystyle W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}((\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1},\tilde{% \mathbf{u}}))|_{G}\neq W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}((\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1},% \tilde{\mathbf{v}}))|_{H}.italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (24)

If (i) is the case, Duplicator loses after the n~~𝑛\tilde{n}over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-th putting move of the initialization round. Otherwise, for any bijection f:ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1→ℛn~⁢(H)\𝐯n~−1:𝑓→\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻subscript𝐯~𝑛1f:\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)\backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1}\rightarrow% \mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(H)\backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Duplicator chooses for the n~~𝑛\tilde{n}over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-th putting move, Spoiler can put pebbles pin~−1+1,pin~−1+2,…,pin~subscript𝑝subscript𝑖~𝑛11subscript𝑝subscript𝑖~𝑛12…subscript𝑝subscript𝑖~𝑛p_{i_{\tilde{n}-1}+1},p_{i_{\tilde{n}-1}+2},\ldots,p_{i_{\tilde{n}}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at Δ⁢𝐮n~=𝐮~∈ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1Δsubscript𝐮~𝑛~𝐮\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1\Delta\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}}=\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)% \backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1}roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Duplicator then puts qin~−1+1,qin~−1+2,…,qin~subscript𝑞subscript𝑖~𝑛11subscript𝑞subscript𝑖~𝑛12…subscript𝑞subscript𝑖~𝑛q_{i_{\tilde{n}-1}+1},q_{i_{\tilde{n}-1}+2},\ldots,q_{i_{\tilde{n}}}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at Δ⁢𝐯n~=𝐯~∈ℛn~⁢(H)\𝐯n~−1Δsubscript𝐯~𝑛~𝐯\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻subscript𝐯~𝑛1\Delta\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}}=\tilde{\mathbf{v}}\in\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(H)% \backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}roman_Δ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. After the n~~𝑛\tilde{n}over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-th putting move, we have 𝐮n~=(𝐮n~−1,𝐮~)subscript𝐮~𝑛subscript𝐮~𝑛1~𝐮\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}}=(\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1},\tilde{\mathbf{u}})bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) and 𝐯n~=(𝐯n~−1,𝐯~)subscript𝐯~𝑛subscript𝐯~𝑛1~𝐯\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}}=(\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1},\tilde{\mathbf{v}})bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ). Therefore, equation (24) implies Wn~(∞)⁢(𝐮n~)|G≠Wn~(∞)⁢(𝐯n~)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐮~𝑛𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐯~𝑛𝐻W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}})|_{G}\neq W_{\tilde{n}}^{(% \infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We have thus proved Lemma B.1 for the case of n=n~𝑛~𝑛n=\tilde{n}italic_n = over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG. We assert by induction that Lemma B.1 holds.
End of proof of Lemma B.1.

Now, using Lemma B.1, we find that given W⁢(G)≠W⁢(H)𝑊𝐺𝑊𝐻W(G)\neq W(H)italic_W ( italic_G ) ≠ italic_W ( italic_H ), either of the two cases happens: (i) Spoiler wins the game in the initialization round; (ii) Spoiler maintains

W(∞)⁢(𝐮N)≠W(∞)⁢(𝐯N)superscript𝑊subscript𝐮𝑁superscript𝑊subscript𝐯𝑁\displaystyle W^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq W^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (25)

after the initialization round, where 𝐮N∈ℛ⁢(G)subscript𝐮𝑁ℛ𝐺\mathbf{u}_{N}\in\mathcal{R}(G)bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_R ( italic_G ) and 𝐯N∈ℛ⁢(H)subscript𝐯𝑁ℛ𝐻\mathbf{v}_{N}\in\mathcal{R}(H)bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_R ( italic_H ) are the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples occupied by pebbles p1,…,pksubscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝𝑘p_{1},\ldots,p_{k}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and q1,…,qksubscript𝑞1…subscript𝑞𝑘q_{1},\ldots,q_{k}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT respectively. Since the case (i) trivially implies (b), it suffices to prove that (ii) leads to (b) in the following.

Equation (25) directly implies the following statement: ∃T⩾0,W(T)⁢(𝐮N)≠W(T)⁢(𝐯N)formulae-sequence𝑇0superscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁superscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁\exists T\geqslant 0,W^{(T)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq W^{(T)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})∃ italic_T ⩾ 0 , italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). We assert that

Lemma B.2.

If W(T)⁢(𝐮N)≠W(T)⁢(𝐯N)superscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁superscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁W^{(T)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq W^{(T)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with T⩾0𝑇0T\geqslant 0italic_T ⩾ 0, then Spoiler wins the game no later than the T𝑇Titalic_T-th update round ends. (The initialization round is seen as the 0-th update round.)

If Lemma B.2 holds, we have already finished the proof of (a) ⇒⇒\Rightarrow⇒ (b). To see why Lemma B.2 is true, we need another lemma whose proof we will omit because it resembles the proof of Lemma B.1:

Lemma B.3.

Assume that W(T)⁢(𝐮N)≠W(T)⁢(𝐯N)superscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁superscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁W^{(T)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq W^{(T)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with some T⩾1𝑇1T\geqslant 1italic_T ⩾ 1, in which 𝐮Nsubscript𝐮𝑁\mathbf{u}_{N}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and 𝐯Nsubscript𝐯𝑁\mathbf{v}_{N}bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples occupied by the main pebbles in G𝐺Gitalic_G and H𝐻Hitalic_H after the initialization round, respectively. The following statement holds for all m=1,2,…,M𝑚12…𝑀m=1,2,\ldots,Mitalic_m = 1 , 2 , … , italic_M: if Duplicator has not lost after the (m−1)𝑚1(m-1)( italic_m - 1 )-th putting move of the first update round, then either (i) Duplicator loses after the m𝑚mitalic_m-th putting move of the first update round, or (ii) Spoiler can maintain that

MSGm(T−1)⁢(𝐮m′;𝐮N)|G≠MSGm(T−1)⁢(𝐯m′;𝐯N)|H,evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscriptMSG𝑚𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑚subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscriptMSG𝑚𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑚subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻\displaystyle\mathrm{MSG}_{m}^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{m};\mathbf{u}_{N})|% _{G}\neq\mathrm{MSG}_{m}^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{m};\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H},roman_MSG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ roman_MSG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (26)

after the m𝑚mitalic_m-th putting move of the first update round.

Lemma B.3 is a complete analogue to Lemma B.1. Now we can prove Lemma B.2.

Proof of Lemma B.2. We prove by induction. For the case of T=0𝑇0T=0italic_T = 0, W(0)⁢(𝐮N)≠W(0)⁢(𝐯N)superscript𝑊0subscript𝐮𝑁superscript𝑊0subscript𝐯𝑁W^{(0)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq W^{(0)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) means that

atp⁢(𝐮N)≠atp⁢(𝐯N),atpsubscript𝐮𝑁atpsubscript𝐯𝑁\displaystyle\mathrm{atp}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq\mathrm{atp}(\mathbf{v}_{N}),roman_atp ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ roman_atp ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (27)

because W(0)⁢(⋅)=Φ⁢(atp⁢(⋅))superscript𝑊0⋅Φatp⋅W^{(0)}(\cdot)=\Phi(\mathrm{atp}(\cdot))italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) = roman_Φ ( roman_atp ( ⋅ ) ) is a function of atp⁢(⋅)atp⋅\mathrm{atp}(\cdot)roman_atp ( ⋅ ). Equation (27) immediately implies that Spoiler wins after the initialization round. We have thus proved the case of T=0𝑇0T=0italic_T = 0.

Now, assume that Lemma B.2 holds for the case of T=T~−1𝑇~𝑇1T=\tilde{T}-1italic_T = over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1, in which T~⩾1~𝑇1\tilde{T}\geqslant 1over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ⩾ 1. We have to prove that Lemma B.2 also holds for T=T~𝑇~𝑇T=\tilde{T}italic_T = over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG. When T=T~𝑇~𝑇T=\tilde{T}italic_T = over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG, it is assumed that W(T~)⁢(𝐮N)≠W(T~)⁢(𝐯N)superscript𝑊~𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁superscript𝑊~𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁W^{(\tilde{T})}(\mathbf{u}_{N})\neq W^{(\tilde{T})}(\mathbf{v}_{N})italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Since T~⩾1~𝑇1\tilde{T}\geqslant 1over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ⩾ 1, we can make use of Lemma B.3 (taking m=M𝑚𝑀m=Mitalic_m = italic_M) to see that either of the two cases happens: (i) Duplicator loses in one of the M𝑀Mitalic_M putting moves of the first update round; (ii) after all M𝑀Mitalic_M putting moves, Spoiler can maintain

MSG(T~−1)⁢(𝐮M′;𝐮N)|G≠MSG(T~−1)⁢(𝐯M′;𝐯N)|H,evaluated-atsuperscriptMSG~𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptMSG~𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻\displaystyle\mathrm{MSG}^{(\tilde{T}-1)}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M};\mathbf{u}_{% N})|_{G}\neq\mathrm{MSG}^{(\tilde{T}-1)}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M};\mathbf{v}_{N% })|_{H},roman_MSG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ roman_MSG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (28)

in which 𝐮M′subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M}bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and 𝐯M′subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M}bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the t𝑡titalic_t-tuples occupied by pebbles pk+1,pk+2,…,pk+tsubscript𝑝𝑘1subscript𝑝𝑘2…subscript𝑝𝑘𝑡p_{k+1},p_{k+2},\ldots,p_{k+t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and qk+1,qk+2,…,qk+tsubscript𝑞𝑘1subscript𝑞𝑘2…subscript𝑞𝑘𝑡q_{k+1},q_{k+2},\ldots,q_{k+t}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT respectively. If (i) is the case, we immediately know that Lemma B.2 is true for T=T~𝑇~𝑇T=\tilde{T}italic_T = over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG. Otherwise, by equation (9) we know that either

Ψ⁢(atp⁢((𝐮N,𝐮M′)))≠Ψ⁢(atp⁢((𝐯N,𝐯M′))),Ψatpsubscript𝐮𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀Ψatpsubscript𝐯𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀\displaystyle\Psi(\mathrm{atp}((\mathbf{u}_{N},\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M})))\neq% \Psi(\mathrm{atp}((\mathbf{v}_{N},\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M}))),roman_Ψ ( roman_atp ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) ≠ roman_Ψ ( roman_atp ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) , (29)

or ∃c∈[C]𝑐delimited-[]𝐶\exists c\in[C]∃ italic_c ∈ [ italic_C ], such that

W(T~−1)⁢((𝐮N)c⁢(𝐮M′))|G≠W(T~−1)⁢((𝐯N)c⁢(𝐯M′))|H.evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊~𝑇1subscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊~𝑇1subscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀𝐻\displaystyle W^{(\tilde{T}-1)}\left((\mathbf{u}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_% {M})\right)|_{G}\neq W^{(\tilde{T}-1)}\left((\mathbf{v}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{v}^{% \prime}_{M})\right)|_{H}.italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (30)

If the former is the case, we know that Spoiler already wins in the first update round, since (𝐮N,𝐮M′)subscript𝐮𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀(\mathbf{u}_{N},\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M})( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (𝐯N,𝐯M′)subscript𝐯𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀(\mathbf{v}_{N},\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M})( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) have different isomorphism types. This again leads to Lemma B.2 with T=T~⩾1𝑇~𝑇1T=\tilde{T}\geqslant 1italic_T = over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ⩾ 1. If the latter is the case, let us notice that in equation (30), (𝐮N)c⁢(𝐮M′)=REPLACE⁢(𝐮N,𝐮M′;r1(c),…⁢rk(c))subscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀REPLACEsubscript𝐮𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀superscriptsubscript𝑟1𝑐…superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘𝑐(\mathbf{u}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M})=\mathrm{REPLACE}(\mathbf{u}_{N},% \mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M};r_{1}^{(c)},\ldots r_{k}^{(c)})( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_REPLACE ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is exactly the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuple occupied by the pebbles pr1(c),…,prk(c)subscript𝑝superscriptsubscript𝑟1𝑐…subscript𝑝superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘𝑐p_{r_{1}^{(c)}},\ldots,p_{r_{k}^{(c)}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after all M𝑀Mitalic_M putting moves; similarly, (𝐯N)c⁢(𝐯M′)subscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀(\mathbf{v}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M})( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuple occupied by pebbles qr1(c),…,qrk(c)subscript𝑞superscriptsubscript𝑟1𝑐…subscript𝑞superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘𝑐q_{r_{1}^{(c)}},\ldots,q_{r_{k}^{(c)}}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after the M𝑀Mitalic_M putting moves. From Spoiler’s perspective, he finds that by choosing the sequence r1(c),…,rk(c)superscriptsubscript𝑟1𝑐…superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘𝑐r_{1}^{(c)},\ldots,r_{k}^{(c)}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in the subsequent removing move, he can ensure that the pebbles p1,…,pksubscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝𝑘p_{1},\ldots,p_{k}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and q1,…,qksubscript𝑞1…subscript𝑞𝑘q_{1},\ldots,q_{k}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT should be moved to (𝐮N)c⁢(𝐮M′)subscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀(\mathbf{u}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M})( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (𝐯N)c⁢(𝐯M′)subscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀(\mathbf{v}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M})( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), respectively. By equation (30), Spoiler can actually ensure that

W(T~−1)⁢(𝐮N∗)|G≠W(T~−1)⁢(𝐯N∗)|H,evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊~𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊~𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐯𝑁𝐻\displaystyle W^{(\tilde{T}-1)}(\mathbf{u}^{*}_{N})|_{G}\neq W^{(\tilde{T}-1)}% (\mathbf{v}^{*}_{N})|_{H},italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (31)

in which 𝐮N∗subscriptsuperscript𝐮𝑁\mathbf{u}^{*}_{N}bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and 𝐯N∗subscriptsuperscript𝐯𝑁\mathbf{v}^{*}_{N}bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples occupied by pebbles p1,…,pksubscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝𝑘p_{1},\ldots,p_{k}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and q1,…,qksubscript𝑞1…subscript𝑞𝑘q_{1},\ldots,q_{k}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT when the first update round ends, respectively. By the inductive hypothesis, equation (31) implies that Spoiler wins the game in at most another (T~−1)~𝑇1(\tilde{T}-1)( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG - 1 ) rounds. Therefore, Spoiler wins no later than the T~~𝑇\tilde{T}over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG-th update round ends. We assert by induction that Lemma B.2 is true.
End of proof of Lemma B.2.

Our desired result is now straightforward.

¬\bm{\neg}bold_¬(a) ⇒bold-⇒\bm{\Rightarrow}bold_⇒ ¬\bm{\neg}bold_¬(b). Since W⁢(G)=W⁢(H)𝑊𝐺𝑊𝐻W(G)=W(H)italic_W ( italic_G ) = italic_W ( italic_H ), we have W0(∞)|G=W0(∞)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐻W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{G}=W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In correspondence to Lemma B.1, we have

Lemma B.4.

If W0(∞)|G=W0(∞)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐻W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{G}=W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then Duplicator can maintain that

Wn(∞)⁢(𝐮n)|G=Wn(∞)⁢(𝐯n)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝑛subscript𝐮𝑛𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝑛subscript𝐯𝑛𝐻\displaystyle W_{n}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{n})|_{G}=W_{n}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v% }_{n})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (32)

after the n𝑛nitalic_n-th putting move of the initialization round, for all n=1,2,…,N𝑛12…𝑁n=1,2,\ldots,Nitalic_n = 1 , 2 , … , italic_N.

Proof of Lemma B.4. We prove by induction. The assumption W0(∞)|G=W0(∞)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊0𝐻W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{G}=W_{0}^{(\infty)}|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT means that equation (19) is false, or equivalently,

{{W1(∞)(𝐮~)|G:𝐮~∈ℛ1(G)}}={{W1(∞)(𝐯~)|H:𝐯~∈ℛ1(H)}}.\displaystyle\{\!\!\{W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})|_{G}:\tilde{\mathbf{% u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)\}\!\!\}=\{\!\!\{W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\tilde{\mathbf{v}})|% _{H}:\tilde{\mathbf{v}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)\}\!\!\}.{ { italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) } } = { { italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : over~ start_ARG bold_v end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) } } . (33)

In other words, there exists a bijection f:ℛ1⁢(G)→ℛ1⁢(H):𝑓→subscriptℛ1𝐺subscriptℛ1𝐻f:\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)\rightarrow\mathcal{R}_{1}(H)italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) such that

∀𝐮~∈ℛ1⁢(G),W1(∞)⁢(𝐮~)|G=W1(∞)⁢(f⁢(𝐮~))|H.formulae-sequencefor-all~𝐮subscriptℛ1𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1~𝐮𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1𝑓~𝐮𝐻\displaystyle\forall\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(G),\quad W_{1}^{(% \infty)}(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})|_{G}=W_{1}^{(\infty)}(f(\tilde{\mathbf{u}}))|_{H}.∀ over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) , italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (34)

By choosing the bijection f𝑓fitalic_f that satisfies (34), Duplicator can maintain that W1(∞)⁢(𝐮1)|G=W1(∞)⁢(𝐯1)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1subscript𝐮1𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊1subscript𝐯1𝐻W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{1})|_{G}=W_{1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{1})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after the first putting move of the initialization round. We have thus proved the case of n=1𝑛1n=1italic_n = 1.

If Lemma B.4 holds for n=n~−1𝑛~𝑛1n=\tilde{n}-1italic_n = over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 with some 2⩽n~⩽N2~𝑛𝑁2\leqslant\tilde{n}\leqslant N2 ⩽ over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ⩽ italic_N, we know that Duplicator can already maintain that

Wn~−1(∞)⁢(𝐮n~−1)|G=Wn~−1(∞)⁢(𝐯n~−1)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛1subscript𝐮~𝑛1𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛1subscript𝐯~𝑛1𝐻\displaystyle W_{\tilde{n}-1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1})|_{G}=W_{% \tilde{n}-1}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (35)

after the (n~−1)~𝑛1(\tilde{n}-1)( over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 )-th putting move of the initialization round. Equation (35) means that (23) is false, which implies that there exists a bijection f:ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1→ℛn~⁢(H)\𝐯n~−1:𝑓→\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐻subscript𝐯~𝑛1f:\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)\backslash\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1}\rightarrow% \mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(H)\backslash\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-1}italic_f : caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT → caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H ) \ bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, such that

∀𝐮~∈ℛn~⁢(G)\𝐮n~−1,Wn~(∞)⁢((𝐮n~−1,𝐮~))|G=Wn~(∞)⁢((𝐯n~−1,f⁢(𝐮~)))|H.formulae-sequencefor-all~𝐮\subscriptℛ~𝑛𝐺subscript𝐮~𝑛1evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐮~𝑛1~𝐮𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐯~𝑛1𝑓~𝐮𝐻\displaystyle\forall\tilde{\mathbf{u}}\in\mathcal{R}_{\tilde{n}}(G)\backslash% \mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}-1},\quad W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}((\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}% -1},\tilde{\mathbf{u}}))|_{G}=W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}((\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}-% 1},f(\tilde{\mathbf{u}})))|_{H}.∀ over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ) \ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f ( over~ start_ARG bold_u end_ARG ) ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (36)

Choosing the bijection f𝑓fitalic_f that satisfies (36) enables Duplicator to maintain Wn~(∞)⁢(𝐮n~)|G=Wn~(∞)⁢(𝐯n~)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐮~𝑛𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscript𝑊~𝑛subscript𝐯~𝑛𝐻W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{\tilde{n}})|_{G}=W_{\tilde{n}}^{(\infty)}% (\mathbf{v}_{\tilde{n}})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after the next putting move (i.e., the n~~𝑛\tilde{n}over~ start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-th putting move of the initialization round). We have thus made the induction step. Now we assert that Lemma B.4 holds.
End of proof of Lemma B.4.

To get our desired result, we still need the following lemma:

Lemma B.5.

Assume that W(T)⁢(𝐮N)|G=W(T)⁢(𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})|_{G}=W^{(T)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with some T⩾1𝑇1T\geqslant 1italic_T ⩾ 1, in which 𝐮Nsubscript𝐮𝑁\mathbf{u}_{N}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and 𝐯Nsubscript𝐯𝑁\mathbf{v}_{N}bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples occupied by the main pebbles in G𝐺Gitalic_G and H𝐻Hitalic_H after the initialization round, respectively. Then, Duplicator can maintain W(T−1)⁢(𝐮N∗)|G=W(T−1)⁢(𝐯N∗)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇1superscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇1superscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{u}_{N}^{*})|_{G}=W^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{v}_{N}^{*})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after the first update round, in which 𝐮N∗superscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁\mathbf{u}_{N}^{*}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and 𝐯N∗superscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁\mathbf{v}_{N}^{*}bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples occupied by the main pebbles in G𝐺Gitalic_G and H𝐻Hitalic_H after the first update round, respectively.

To prove Lemma B.5, we make use of the following Lemma B.6. Due to its similarity to Lemma B.4, we omit its proof.

Lemma B.6.

If W(T)⁢(𝐮N)|G=W(T)⁢(𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})|_{G}=W^{(T)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with some T⩾1𝑇1T\geqslant 1italic_T ⩾ 1, then Duplicator can maintain that

MSGm(T−1)⁢(𝐮m′;𝐮N)|G=MSGm(T−1)⁢(𝐯m′;𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptsubscriptMSG𝑚𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑚subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptsubscriptMSG𝑚𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑚subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻\displaystyle\mathrm{MSG}_{m}^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{m};\mathbf{u}_{N})|% _{G}=\mathrm{MSG}_{m}^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{m};\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H}roman_MSG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_MSG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (37)

after the m𝑚mitalic_m-th putting move of the first update round, for all m=1,2,…,M𝑚12…𝑀m=1,2,\ldots,Mitalic_m = 1 , 2 , … , italic_M.

Taking m=M𝑚𝑀m=Mitalic_m = italic_M in Lemma B.6, we find that W(T)⁢(𝐮N)|G=W(T)⁢(𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})|_{G}=W^{(T)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT implies that Duplicator can maintain

MSG(T−1)⁢(𝐮M′;𝐮N)|G=MSG(T−1)⁢(𝐯M′;𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscriptMSG𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscriptMSG𝑇1subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻\displaystyle\mathrm{MSG}^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M};\mathbf{u}_{N})|_{G}% =\mathrm{MSG}^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M};\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H}roman_MSG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_MSG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (38)

after all M𝑀Mitalic_M putting moves of the first update round. By (9), this means that atp⁢((𝐮N,𝐮M′))=atp⁢((𝐯N,𝐯M′))atpsubscript𝐮𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀atpsubscript𝐯𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀\mathrm{atp}((\mathbf{u}_{N},\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M}))=\mathrm{atp}((\mathbf{v% }_{N},\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M}))roman_atp ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = roman_atp ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) and that ∀c∈[C]for-all𝑐delimited-[]𝐶\forall c\in[C]∀ italic_c ∈ [ italic_C ], W(T−1)⁢((𝐮N)c⁢(𝐮M′))|G=W(T−1)⁢((𝐯N)c⁢(𝐯M′))|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇1subscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑀𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇1subscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝐯′𝑀𝐻W^{(T-1)}\left((\mathbf{u}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{u}^{\prime}_{M})\right)|_{G}=W^{(T% -1)}\left((\mathbf{v}_{N})_{c}(\mathbf{v}^{\prime}_{M})\right)|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The former condition guarantees that Duplicator has not lost after M𝑀Mitalic_M putting moves, while the latter means that no matter what sequence r1(c),…,rk(c)superscriptsubscript𝑟1𝑐…superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘𝑐r_{1}^{(c)},\ldots,r_{k}^{(c)}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Spoiler chooses, the removing move must end up with p1,…,pksubscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝𝑘p_{1},\ldots,p_{k}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and q1,…,qksubscript𝑞1…subscript𝑞𝑘q_{1},\ldots,q_{k}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT moved to some 𝐮N∗superscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁\mathbf{u}_{N}^{*}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and 𝐯N∗superscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁\mathbf{v}_{N}^{*}bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT that satisfy W(T−1)⁢(𝐮N∗)|G=W(T−1)⁢(𝐯N∗)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇1superscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝑇1superscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{u}_{N}^{*})|_{G}=W^{(T-1)}(\mathbf{v}_{N}^{*})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Lemma B.5 is thus proved.

Now we may turn to proving ¬\neg¬(a) ⇒⇒\Rightarrow⇒ ¬\neg¬(b). Taking n=N𝑛𝑁n=Nitalic_n = italic_N in Lemma B.4, we find that given W⁢(G)=W⁢(H)𝑊𝐺𝑊𝐻W(G)=W(H)italic_W ( italic_G ) = italic_W ( italic_H ), Duplicator can maintain that

W(∞)⁢(𝐮N)|G=W(∞)⁢(𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻\displaystyle W^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u}_{N})|_{G}=W^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v}_{N})|_% {H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (39)

at the end of the initialization round, where 𝐮Nsubscript𝐮𝑁\mathbf{u}_{N}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and 𝐯Nsubscript𝐯𝑁\mathbf{v}_{N}bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples occupied by pebbles p1,…,pksubscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝𝑘p_{1},\ldots,p_{k}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and q1,…,qksubscript𝑞1…subscript𝑞𝑘q_{1},\ldots,q_{k}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively. Since W(∞)⁢(⋅)|Gevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊⋅𝐺W^{(\infty)}(\cdot)|_{G}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and W(∞)⁢(⋅)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊⋅𝐻W^{(\infty)}(\cdot)|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are stable colorings of k𝑘kitalic_k-tuples, there exists T∗⩾1superscript𝑇1T^{*}\geqslant 1italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⩾ 1 such that

∀𝐮∈ℛ⁢(G),W(T∗)⁢(𝐮)|G=W(T∗−1)⁢(𝐮)|G=W(∞)⁢(𝐮)|G,formulae-sequencefor-all𝐮ℛ𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇𝐮𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇1𝐮𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝐮𝐺\displaystyle\forall\mathbf{u}\in\mathcal{R}(G),\quad W^{(T^{*})}(\mathbf{u})|% _{G}=W^{(T^{*}-1)}(\mathbf{u})|_{G}=W^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{u})|_{G},∀ bold_u ∈ caligraphic_R ( italic_G ) , italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (40)
∀𝐯∈ℛ⁢(H),W(T∗)⁢(𝐯)|H=W(T∗−1)⁢(𝐯)|H=W(∞)⁢(𝐯)|H.formulae-sequencefor-all𝐯ℛ𝐻evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇𝐯𝐻evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇1𝐯𝐻evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊𝐯𝐻\displaystyle\forall\mathbf{v}\in\mathcal{R}(H),\quad W^{(T^{*})}(\mathbf{v})|% _{H}=W^{(T^{*}-1)}(\mathbf{v})|_{H}=W^{(\infty)}(\mathbf{v})|_{H}.∀ bold_v ∈ caligraphic_R ( italic_H ) , italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∞ ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (41)

Therefore, equation (39) implies that W(T∗)⁢(𝐮N)|G=W(T∗)⁢(𝐯N)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇subscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇subscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T^{*})}(\mathbf{u}_{N})|_{G}=W^{(T^{*})}(\mathbf{v}_{N})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By Lemma B.5, Duplicator can maintain W(T∗−1)⁢(𝐮N∗)|G=W(T∗−1)⁢(𝐯N∗)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇1superscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇1superscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T^{*}-1)}(\mathbf{u}_{N}^{*})|_{G}=W^{(T^{*}-1)}(\mathbf{v}_{N}^{*})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which by (40) and (41) is equivalent to W(T∗)⁢(𝐮N∗)|G=W(T∗)⁢(𝐯N∗)|Hevaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇superscriptsubscript𝐮𝑁𝐺evaluated-atsuperscript𝑊superscript𝑇superscriptsubscript𝐯𝑁𝐻W^{(T^{*})}(\mathbf{u}_{N}^{*})|_{G}=W^{(T^{*})}(\mathbf{v}_{N}^{*})|_{H}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT—a result that allows us to apply the above discussion repeatedly. We eventually find that Duplicator never loses the game. ∎

Appendix C Proof of Theorem 4.12

Proof.

(a) ⇒bold-⇒\bm{\Rightarrow}bold_⇒ (b). The key idea of our proof is to first construct a set of graphs 𝒮⊆𝒢𝒮𝒢\mathcal{S}\subseteq\mathcal{G}caligraphic_S ⊆ caligraphic_G, on each of which Cops win the Cops-Robber game, and then try to prove that at least one graph F∈𝒮𝐹𝒮F\in\mathcal{S}italic_F ∈ caligraphic_S satisfies Hom⁢(F,G)≠Hom⁢(F,H)Hom𝐹𝐺Hom𝐹𝐻\mathrm{Hom}(F,G)\neq\mathrm{Hom}(F,H)roman_Hom ( italic_F , italic_G ) ≠ roman_Hom ( italic_F , italic_H ), given that (a) is true.

We introduce the following notation: given G∈𝒢𝐺𝒢G\in\mathcal{G}italic_G ∈ caligraphic_G and 𝐮=(u1,…,uℓ)∈𝒱Gℓ𝐮subscript𝑢1…subscript𝑢ℓsuperscriptsubscript𝒱𝐺ℓ\mathbf{u}=(u_{1},\ldots,u_{\ell})\in\mathcal{V}_{G}^{\ell}bold_u = ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, let G⁢[𝐮]𝐺delimited-[]𝐮G[\mathbf{u}]italic_G [ bold_u ] be the subgraph of G𝐺Gitalic_G induced by {u1,…,uℓ}subscript𝑢1…subscript𝑢ℓ\{u_{1},\ldots,u_{\ell}\}{ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. It is easy to see that G⁢[𝐮]𝐺delimited-[]𝐮G[\mathbf{u}]italic_G [ bold_u ] is uniquely determined by atp⁢(𝐮)atp𝐮\mathrm{atp}(\mathbf{u})roman_atp ( bold_u ), up to isomorphism.

Definition C.1 (Spoiler’s record graph).

Let G∈𝒢𝐺𝒢G\in\mathcal{G}italic_G ∈ caligraphic_G. Assume that Spoiler and Duplicator are playing the Ehrenfeucht-Fraïssé game on two copies of G𝐺Gitalic_G. For every putting move, Duplicator always chooses the identity mapping as f𝑓fitalic_f. (Therefore, Spoiler never wins the game after any number of rounds.) Spoiler’s actions in the above game are fully determined by the following sequence,

a=(Δ𝐮1(0),…,Δ𝐮N(0),\displaystyle a=\Big{(}\Delta\mathbf{u}_{1}^{(0)},\ldots,\Delta\mathbf{u}_{N}^% {(0)},italic_a = ( roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , Δ⁢𝐮1′⁣(1),…,Δ⁢𝐮M′⁣(1),(r1(c1),…,rk(c1)),Δsubscriptsuperscript𝐮′11…Δsubscriptsuperscript𝐮′1𝑀superscriptsubscript𝑟1subscript𝑐1…superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘subscript𝑐1\displaystyle\Delta\mathbf{u}^{\prime(1)}_{1},\ldots,\Delta\mathbf{u}^{\prime(% 1)}_{M},(r_{1}^{(c_{1})},\ldots,r_{k}^{(c_{1})}),roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,
Δ𝐮1′⁣(2),…,Δ𝐮M′⁣(2),(r1(c2),…,rk(c2)),…,…),\displaystyle\Delta\mathbf{u}^{\prime(2)}_{1},\ldots,\Delta\mathbf{u}^{\prime(% 2)}_{M},(r_{1}^{(c_{2})},\ldots,r_{k}^{(c_{2})}),\ldots,\ldots\Big{)},roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ ( 2 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ ( 2 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , … , … ) , (42)

in which Δ⁢𝐮n(0)Δsuperscriptsubscript𝐮𝑛0\Delta\mathbf{u}_{n}^{(0)}roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (1⩽n⩽N1𝑛𝑁1\leqslant n\leqslant N1 ⩽ italic_n ⩽ italic_N) is the tuple chosen by Spoiler in the n𝑛nitalic_n-th putting move of the initialization round, Δ⁢𝐮m′⁣(T)Δsubscriptsuperscript𝐮′𝑇𝑚\Delta\mathbf{u}^{\prime(T)}_{m}roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (T⩾1,1⩽m⩽Mformulae-sequence𝑇11𝑚𝑀T\geqslant 1,1\leqslant m\leqslant Mitalic_T ⩾ 1 , 1 ⩽ italic_m ⩽ italic_M) is the tuple chosen by Spoiler in the m𝑚mitalic_m-th putting move of the T𝑇Titalic_T-th update round, and (r1(cT),…,rk(cT))superscriptsubscript𝑟1subscript𝑐𝑇…superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘subscript𝑐𝑇(r_{1}^{(c_{T})},\ldots,r_{k}^{(c_{T})})( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (T⩾1𝑇1T\geqslant 1italic_T ⩾ 1) is the sequence chosen by Spoiler in the removing move of the T𝑇Titalic_T-th update round. Based on the action sequence a𝑎aitalic_a, we define a series of Spoiler’s record graphs as following:

  • •

    Construct Fn(0)⁢(G,a)subscriptsuperscript𝐹0𝑛𝐺𝑎F^{(0)}_{n}(G,a)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) (n=0,1,…,N𝑛01…𝑁n=0,1,\ldots,Nitalic_n = 0 , 1 , … , italic_N) via the following steps:

    • ∘\circ∘

      Let F0(0)⁢(G,a)subscriptsuperscript𝐹00𝐺𝑎F^{(0)}_{0}(G,a)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) be an empty graph (whose node set and edge set are both ∅\varnothing∅). For the first move of the initialization round, Spoiler puts pebbles p1,…,pi1subscript𝑝1…subscript𝑝subscript𝑖1p_{1},\ldots,p_{i_{1}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at 𝐮1(0)=Δ⁢𝐮1(0)=(u1(0),…,ui1(0))∈ℛ1⁢(G)superscriptsubscript𝐮10Δsuperscriptsubscript𝐮10superscriptsubscript𝑢10…superscriptsubscript𝑢subscript𝑖10subscriptℛ1𝐺\mathbf{u}_{1}^{(0)}=\Delta\mathbf{u}_{1}^{(0)}=(u_{1}^{(0)},\ldots,u_{i_{1}}^% {(0)})\in\mathcal{R}_{1}(G)bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_Δ bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∈ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G ).     • ∘\circ∘

      Let F(0)⁢(G,a)superscript𝐹0𝐺𝑎F^{(0)}(G,a)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) be an alias of FN(0)⁢(G,a)subscriptsuperscript𝐹0𝑁𝐺𝑎F^{(0)}_{N}(G,a)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ).   • •

    For each of T=1,2,…𝑇12…T=1,2,\ldotsitalic_T = 1 , 2 , …, construct Fm(T)⁢(G,a)subscriptsuperscript𝐹𝑇𝑚𝐺𝑎F^{(T)}_{m}(G,a)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) (m=0,1,…,M𝑚01…𝑀m=0,1,\ldots,Mitalic_m = 0 , 1 , … , italic_M) via the following steps:

    • ∘\circ∘

      Start with F0(T)⁢(G,a)=F(T−1)⁢(G,a)subscriptsuperscript𝐹𝑇0𝐺𝑎superscript𝐹𝑇1𝐺𝑎F^{(T)}_{0}(G,a)=F^{(T-1)}(G,a)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) = italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) and

      φ0(T)=φ(T−1):u1(T−1)↦w1(T−1),⋯,uk(T−1)↦wk(T−1),\displaystyle\varphi^{(T)}_{0}=\varphi^{(T-1)}:\quad u_{1}^{(T-1)}\mapsto w_{1% }^{(T-1)},\cdots,u_{k}^{(T-1)}\mapsto w_{k}^{(T-1)},italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ↦ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ↦ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , (47)

      in which 𝐮N(T−1)=(u1(T−1),…,uk(T−1))subscriptsuperscript𝐮𝑇1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑢1𝑇1…superscriptsubscript𝑢𝑘𝑇1\mathbf{u}^{(T-1)}_{N}=(u_{1}^{(T-1)},\ldots,u_{k}^{(T-1)})bold_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is the k𝑘kitalic_k-tuple occupied by the main pebbles after the (T−1)𝑇1(T-1)( italic_T - 1 )-th update round, and w1(T−1),…,wk(T−1)∈𝒱F(T−1)⁢(G,a)superscriptsubscript𝑤1𝑇1…superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘𝑇1subscript𝒱superscript𝐹𝑇1𝐺𝑎w_{1}^{(T-1)},\ldots,w_{k}^{(T-1)}\in\mathcal{V}_{F^{(T-1)}(G,a)}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_T - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_G , italic_a ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.     • ∘\circ∘

      For the removing move of the T𝑇Titalic_T-th update round, Spoiler chooses the sequence (r1(cT),…,rk(cT))superscriptsubscript𝑟1subscript𝑐𝑇…superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑘subscript𝑐𝑇(r_{1}^{(c_{T})},\ldots,r_{k}^{(c_{T})})( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ).
